conditioning_scale.description: Controls the influence of the input image on the generated output.

strength.description: Controls how much to transform the input image.

seeds.description: Random noise seeds. Default is random seeds for each generation.

store.description: Use "hosted" to return a video URL hosted on Substrate. You can also provide a URL to a registered [file store](https://docs.substrate.run/reference/external-files). If unset, the video data will be returned as a base64-encoded string.

seed.description: Seed for deterministic generation. Default is a random seed.

fps.description: Frames per second of the generated video. Ignored if output format is `frames`.

motion_bucket_id.description: The motion bucket id to use for the generated video. This can be used to control the motion of the generated video. Increasing the motion bucket id increases the motion of the generated video.

noise.description: The amount of noise added to the conditioning image. The higher the values the less the video resembles the conditioning image. Increasing this value also increases the motion of the generated video.

store.description: Use "hosted" to return a video URL hosted on Substrate. You can also provide a URL to a registered [file store](https://docs.substrate.run/reference/external-files). If unset, the video data will be returned as a base64-encoded string.

fps.description: Frames per second of the generated video. Ignored if output format is `frames`.

num_steps.description: Number of interpolation steps. Each step adds an interpolated frame between adjacent frames. For example, 2 steps over 2 frames produces 5 frames.

point_prompts.description: Point prompts, to detect a segment under the point. One of `point_prompts` or `box_prompts` must be set.

prompt.description: Prompt to guide model on the content and context of input audio.

language.description: Language of input audio in [ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format.

segment.description: Segment the text into sentences with approximate timestamps.

align.description: Align transcription to produce more accurate sentence-level timestamps and word-level timestamps. An array of word segments will be included in each sentence segment.

diarize.description: Identify speakers for each segment. Speaker IDs will be included in each segment.

start.description: Start time of word, in seconds.

end.description: End time of word, in seconds.

speaker.description: ID of speaker, if `diarize` is enabled.

start.description: Start time of segment, in seconds.

end.description: End time of segment, in seconds.

chunk_size.description: Maximum number of units per chunk. Defaults to 1024 tokens for text or 40 lines for code.

chunk_overlap.description: Number of units to overlap between chunks. Defaults to 200 tokens for text or 15 lines for code.

example.text: Argon is the third most abundant gas in Earth's atmosphere, at 0.934% (9340 ppmv). It is more than twice as abundant as water vapor.

group: 18

Argon is the third most abundant gas in Earth's atmosphere, at 0.934% (9340 ppmv). It is more than twice as abundant as water vapor.

post.description: Generate embeddings for multiple text documents.

items.text: Osmium is the densest naturally occurring element. When experimentally measured using X-ray crystallography, it has a density of 22.59 g/cm3. Manufacturers use its alloys with platinum, iridium, and other platinum-group metals to make fountain pen nib tipping, electrical contacts, and in other applications that require extreme durability and hardness.
Despite its abundant presence in the universe and Solar Systemranking fifth in cosmic abundance following hydrogen, helium, oxygen, and carbonneon is comparatively scarce on Earth.

group: 8

items.text: Hassium is a superheavy element; it has been produced in a laboratory only in very small quantities by fusing heavy nuclei with lighter ones. Natural occurrences of the element have been hypothesised but never found.
Xenon is also used to search for hypothetical weakly interacting massive particles and as a propellant for ion thrusters in spacecraft.
